text: so this was a workspace where you could
have you know supported different
syntaxes so a database
uh you have a whole bunch of plain text
files and then it would
read the syntax from them and parse out
a database and make it live so you could
have live queries of all this
interesting things
all interesting
but
um
i was going through huge amounts of work
extra work to support the plain text
aspect right all these extra
formats and syntax highlighting and it
still always looks kind of programmery
at the end right
and so
bike
is not plain text bike is html based or
opm elba it's a markup language based
and i've sort of decided that
for me
making selecting some text and making it
bold just looks so much better and i can
think better with that than adding
markdown syntax or some other syntax
which
i have advocated in the past but it just
yeah but i started taking notes on the
ipad just a little bit in the notes
program and i always always like you
know sort of notes being when i'm
thinking through a design and i was like
wow these are easier to read than what
i'm doing in my other tool where i see
all this formatting
and links or
folding text i did a lot of work to hide
that formatting but it still makes
everything complicated
and so bike was just like let's get rid
of that and just make something that's
easy to parse
but you don't have to see all the syntax
everywhere
